question.body: Target cell receptors for melatonin are found in the hypothalamus and pituitary. What is the functional significance of this anatomical feature?

part.explanation: Through the major homeostasis centers and “master gland” with tropic hormones, melatonin can influence many different targets in the body. Normally this sets up a circadian rhythm of metabolism, but it also accounts for the wide range of effects associated with jet lag or shift work.
